column1: A little within the wood there was a fair castle
column3: and surrounded by stout walls. Here dwelt that noble knight
column5: to whom Robin Hood had lent the four hundred pounds to redeem his land.He saw the little company of outlaws fighting their way along
column6: so he hastened to call them to come and take shelter in his castle."Welcome art thou
column8: as he led them in. "Much I thank thee for thy comfort and courtesy and great kindness to me in the forest. There is no man in the world I love so much as thee. For all the proud Sheriff of Nottingham
column9: here thou shalt be safe!—Shut the gates
column11: and let no man come in!" he shouted to his retainers. "Arm you well; make ready; guard the walls! One thing
column13: I promise thee: here shalt thou stay for twelve days as my guest
column16: and dine."Swiftly and readily tables were laid and cloths spread
column17: and Robin Hood and his merry men sat down to a good meal.
